commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: What?! You got to talk with Aqours yesterday? There was some stuff I wanted to talk to them about, too!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Kasumi, calm down. They were just doing a little personal problem solving.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Right. Sorry.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Don't worry about it, Kasumi. Sorry I dragged you all through this. I feel a little better after talking to Aqours.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: They told me to just call Maki, so I think I'm gonna do it.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah, I think they're right. It's better to talk to her directly. I'm sure you'll feel much better after.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (I wonder if Maki will pick up.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey, Maki? It's me...

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Oh, hey! *Giggle* Calling for another challenge?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Sorry for calling out of the blue, but I just wanted ask how you composed the song you played that day.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: What?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The song I wrote the other day was for everyone in Nijigasaki, but I just can't imagine them singing it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I can't stop thinking about why I feel this way.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Hold on right there! I can't sort everything out if you blab all at once!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, sorry. I couldn't help myself.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: I really like how positive you are about this. So, in short, you want to know how I compose our songs, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: I didn't do anything special because it was a song-off. I just wrote as usual. Just like when you came to interview us.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: When I came to interview you...oh!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Rin and Hanayo were next to you, cheering you on as you played the piano, until eventually everyone was singing together. Right?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Yeah, just like that. I'd love to write by myself, but...

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Well, let's just say they give me some extra inspiration sometimes.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Do you ever have trouble writing your songs? I had a tough time not long ago, researching all your songs, sitting for hours on end in front of the piano.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Right, it happens. That's part of μ's' activities though.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Singing, dancing, and song writing. To me, it's all apart of being in μ's.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: It's fun being in μ's. I'm trying to have fun with every aspect of being a school idol.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Have fun with it...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Heyo! Don't just talk to Maki. Let us in on it, too!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Honoka?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Everyone just happens to be here right now. Don't you think it's better to talk in person than on the phone?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: You should come on over!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: W-Won't I be interrupting?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: No, not at all. You're more than welcome, right Rin?

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: Yeah, I want to see you again!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Hehe, sorry for all the commotion. Everyone's up for it, so why don't you come?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thank you! I'll be there as soon as I can!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Welcome! Here, have some of our delicious sweet buns from Homura Bakery.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thanks. *Munch* This is good!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: *Chuckle* I wish you included stuff about our bakery in your article.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Oh yeah, we all read it together, you know!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Yes, we were talking about that with everyone. Thanks for writing such a great article.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: You really did observe us closely. Thank you.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Ummm. It made me so happy.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I'm kind of jealous of everyone in Nijigasaki.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: If you understood us in such a short time, I'm sure you understand them very well.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Nijigasaki must feel highly confident having someone that understands them so deeply.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: G-Guys, I think you're exaggerating.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Ugh... I know how you guys feel, but we didn't meet up to just compliment her until she drops.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Y-Yeah, that's right. I said this on the phone, but I want to ask Maki about how she writes songs.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: However, I feel the same as everyone else. It'd be a great help if you were in our group.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: I bet we could talk to you about anything.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Plus, when you have an objective observer to give you advice, it probably allows you to notice things you normally couldn't.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yeah, it'd be great to have someone to share our thoughts, goals, and accomplishments with!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: When I composed μ's' first song, I didn't know anything about everyone.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: You've always been writing music just for them. That's something truly incredible.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (For them? I don't think I had thought of that at all. I kept thinking about composing a song like μ's'.)

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Hm? Did you freeze up? Are you choking on the sweet bun?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Oh no! Quick, have some tea!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: S-Sorry! I'm okay though.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I just noticed something important thanks to all of you. I know I just got here, but I need to get going. Thanks!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: What the heck was that? She just rushed off.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: I wanted to talk more!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: She seemed much more relieved than when she arrived, don't you think?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Yeah. There's so much that goes on when you first start off in the world of school idols.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: It'd be great if we provided some kind of advice.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Aww, I wanted to talk about school idols more.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: I'm glad we didn't get sucked into one of your long conversations.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: What is that supposed to mean?!
